issue.title: CFn: fix reserved python keyword usage in scaffolding plugin

labels.name: aws:cloudformation
labels.description: AWS CloudFormation

labels.name: semver: patch
labels.description: Non-breaking bugfix PR which can be contained in patch releases

issue.body:
<!-- Please refer to the contribution guidelines before raising a PR: https://github.com/localstack/localstack/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md -->

<!-- Why am I raising this PR? Add context such as related issues, PRs, or documentation. -->
## Motivation

There was an issue when generating the Lambda resources. It would generate an import path containing the word "lambda", which is a reserved keyword in Python. The actual failure was when trying to run `black` over the codebase.

<!-- What notable changes does this PR make? -->
## Changes

- Use python compatible name for module
- Sort resource provider list to reduce the number of merge conflicts
- Add option to not run black, since running black is a common source of errors. It checks the code is valid Python, but sometimes you just want to scaffold a resource and fix the issues yourself. Black will be run on the resulting file anyway.

## Testing

`python -m localstack.services.cloudformation.scaffold generate -r "AWS::Lambda::Version"` should work

<!-- The following sections are optional, but can be useful! 


Description of how to test the changes

## TODO

What's left to do:

- [ ] ...
- [ ] ...

-->

pull_request.title: Remove aws_stack.get_region() from test helpers
pull_request.body:
## Motivation

This PR removes the use of `aws_stack.get_region()` from `create_client_with_keys` helper and propagates this change across the codebase.

Use of `aws_stack.get_region()` is associated with several bugs when using multi-region and is currently being removed from the codebase.

labels.name: semver: patch
labels.description: Non-breaking bugfix PR which can be contained in patch releases

issue.title: Latest master branch issue: 'localstack' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
issue.body:
<!-- Love localstack? Please consider supporting our collective:
👉  https://opencollective.com/localstack/donate -->
I am on Windows 7. I downloaded the latest master branch. Followed the steps to install localstack still get the following error upon doing localstack start.

'localstack' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

Python and pip are correctly added to the path already.
D:\LocalStack\localstack-master>python
Python 3.6.5 (v3.6.5:f59c0932b4, Mar 28 2018, 16:07:46) [MSC v.1900 32 bit (Intel)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>>

D:\LocalStack\localstack-master>pip freeze
airspeed==0.5.5.dev20160812
asn1crypto==0.24.0
aws-xray-sdk==0.95
awscli==1.15.4
boto==2.46.1
boto3==1.7.4
botocore==1.10.4
cachetools==0.8.0
...
...

Please advise. Thanks!

comment.body:
I had the same problem. I added the path but still the problem persisted. So I started afresh.
(I am on Windows 10)

Following is what I did 
1. Downloaded the respective binary for my architecture directly from https://docs.localstack.cloud/getting-started/installation/

2. Extracted the file

3. After extraction, moved to the directory. 
The problem is, If I just run **localstack --version** from the directory, I got an error saying 
**"localstack : The term 'localstack' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the
spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again."**

this was because localstack command is not found in my system's PATH, and I was running it from a directory where it is not recognized as an executable. 

So instead , I ran the command **.\localstack --version** and this worked!

I am not sure how much this will help you.

I am just a beginner and sharing whatever has helped me to go around the problem.

commits.message: Remove deprecated config DEFAULT_REGION (#9375)

pull_request.title: Remove deprecated config DEFAULT_REGION
pull_request.body:
## Motivation

The `DEFAULT_REGION` environment config variable was used in early years of LocalStack when multi-region was unsupported. It has since been deprecated.

This PR removes this config variable for the upcoming major release.

labels.name: semver: major
labels.description: PR containing breaking changes which can only be released in a major release.

issue.title: bug: Lambda invocation times out repeatedly

labels.name: type: question
labels.description: Please move questions to discuss.localstack.cloud

labels.name: aws:lambda
labels.description: AWS Lambda

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

When running localstack I am able to successfully create a layer and lambda function. However, when I try to invoke the function it times out. After the invocation, I see this same error get logged repeatedly by the container.
```
local-localstack-1  | 2023-08-09T19:34:00.199  WARN --- [   Thread-20] l.s.l.i.runtime_environmen : Executor 6fe9edeacaa6f62a052023e6d2d17e32 for function arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:000000000000:function:my-lambda:$LATEST timed out during startup
```

### Expected Behavior

The lambda function should be invoked.

### How are you starting LocalStack?

With a docker-compose file

### Steps To Reproduce

Here is my `docker-compose.yml`:
```
version: '3.8'
services:
  localstack:
    image: localstack/localstack-pro:latest
    environment:
      - LOCALSTACK_API_KEY=${LOCALSTACK_API_KEY- }
      - SERVICES=lambda,logs
      - DEBUG=0
    ports:
      - "53:53"
      - "53:53/udp"
      - "443:443"
      - '4566:4566'
    volumes:
      - "/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock"
```

Steps to reproduce:
```
docker-compose up

# Create a layer that contains the numpy dependency
aws lambda publish-layer-version --region us-east-1 --endpoint-url http://localhost:4566 \
  --layer-name my-layer \
  --zip-file fileb://../../lambda/layers/numpy-layer.zip
    
# Create the lambda function
aws lambda create-function --region us-east-1 --endpoint-url http://localhost:4566 \
  --function-name my-lambda \
  --role arn:aws:iam::000000000000:role/lambda-role \
  --runtime python3.10 \
  --zip-file fileb://./../../lambda/poc/lambda.zip \
  --layers arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:000000000000:layer:my-layer:1   <–– Generated from previous command
  
  # Invoke the lambda (which causes the error I'm seeing)
  aws lambda invoke --region us-east-1 --endpoint-url http://localhost:4566 \
    --function-name my-lambda \
    response.json
```

I see the error mentioned above begin to log after running the invoke command.

My `lamba.zip` contains a single file `handler.py` that looks like this:
```
import numpy

def handler(event, context):
    print(str(np.cos(0)))
    return "Test";
```

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: macOS 13.5
- LocalStack: 2.2.1.dev20230809125028
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

comment.body:
Hi @shen-qin 👋 

@shen-qin  Can you quickly confirm whether you are working on the same issue/same team as @aryamohanan ?

---

@shen-qin The most recent logs indicate that there is some other issue with the Lambda image:

```
fork/exec /var/task/bootstrap: no such file    or directory
```

❓ Are you using some customized Lambda image that does not contain a bootstrap file?

❓ Can you share a minimal example to reproduce the issue? Feel free to link a Github repository with a minimal reproducer sample.

review.body: Awesome! Great to see the restructuring getting over the line, paving the way for removing all the legacy code! :rocket: :broom:

pull_request.title: Move lambda v1 to legacy package
pull_request.body:
## Motivation

This PR prepares for removing the old Lambda provider. We want to minimize the major changes upon 3.0 and therefore move lambda code to a legacy package.

## Changes

* Move Lambda V1 implementation to `legacy` package (similar how it already exists in localstack-ext)
* Refactor tests and deprecated usages of `lambda_util.py` (mainly related to Runtime variables)
* Split up `lambda_utils.py`:
  * Move old code into `legacy`
  * Move event source listener helpers into a separate file `event_source_listerners/utils.py`
  * Move Docker/container networking helpers into separate file `networking.py`

## TODO

This first iteration is ready. Some refinements can be tackled in more limited scoped follow-ups.

See [internal Notion task](https://www.notion.so/localstack/Move-everything-related-to-old-Lambda-provider-to-legacy-package-243e8e5e886b4c47be5a02bdd31c66ca?pvs=4)

review.body:
Wow, quite an extensive set of changes, that's awesome! This is really a great!
I just have a question concerning the ApiGatewayStore instantiation with default values. Will we have a solution in the future for this use case? I'd like to know if we can have an idea of what to do to fix this issue before changing it that way.

pull_request.title: Make ARN builders require account ID and region args
pull_request.body:
## Motivation

ARNs in LocalStack were incorrect in certain situations because they used account ID and region from the thread context via the use of `get_aws_account_id()` and `aws_stack.get_region()`.

## Implementation

This PR is a complete refactoring of our ARN builder utilities that make the `account_id` and `region_name` field mandatory. The correct values for these are passed down the from the request context.

## Related

Depends on:
- https://github.com/localstack/localstack/pull/9400
- https://github.com/localstack/localstack/pull/9401
- https://github.com/localstack/localstack/pull/9418

labels.name: semver: patch
labels.description: Non-breaking bugfix PR which can be contained in patch releases

         # create event source for sqs lambda processor
         event_source_data = {
             "FunctionName": integration_lambda,
-            "EventSourceArn": arns.sqs_queue_arn(sqs_queue),
+            "EventSourceArn": arns.sqs_queue_arn(
+                sqs_queue, account_id=TEST_AWS_ACCOUNT_ID, region_name=TEST_AWS_REGION_NAME
+            ),

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -1732,14 +1753,10 @@ def is_index_query_valid(account_id: str, region_name: str, query_data: dict) ->
     return True
 
 
-def has_streams_enabled(table_name: str):
+def has_streams_enabled(account_id: str, region_name: str, table_name: str):
     if not table_name:
         return
-    table_arn = arns.dynamodb_table_arn(table_name)
-    # TODO: change this, it's using `_resource_arn` which calls get_aws_account_id() and get_region() which we
-    #  are extracting from the ARN after?
-    account_id = extract_account_id_from_arn(table_arn)
-    region_name = extract_region_from_arn(table_arn)
+    table_arn = arns.dynamodb_table_arn(table_name, account_id=account_id, region_name=region_name)

pull_request.title: Make ARN builders require account ID and region args
pull_request.body:
## Motivation

ARNs in LocalStack were incorrect in certain situations because they used account ID and region from the thread context via the use of `get_aws_account_id()` and `aws_stack.get_region()`.

## Implementation

This PR is a complete refactoring of our ARN builder utilities that make the `account_id` and `region_name` field mandatory. The correct values for these are passed down the from the request context.

## Related

Depends on:
- https://github.com/localstack/localstack/pull/9400
- https://github.com/localstack/localstack/pull/9401
- https://github.com/localstack/localstack/pull/9418

labels.name: semver: patch
labels.description: Non-breaking bugfix PR which can be contained in patch releases

repo.name: localstack
repo.description: 💻 A fully functional local AWS cloud stack. Develop and test your cloud & Serverless apps offline

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -82,7 +83,9 @@ def __init__(self):
 
         self.account.update(
             {
-                "cloudwatchRoleArn": arns.role_arn("api-gw-cw-role"),
+                "cloudwatchRoleArn": arns.role_arn(
+                    "api-gw-cw-role", DEFAULT_AWS_ACCOUNT_ID
+                ),  # FIXME: account ID must be of the current store
comment.body:
I see the problem here, the `_account_id` field of the store is not passed to the `__init__` called but manually attached later on to the store, so we can't access it here. Was there a specific reason it was done this way?

I don't think this mimics the current behaviour though:
```bash
$ awslocal apigateway get-account
{
    "cloudwatchRoleArn": "arn:aws:iam::000000000000:role/api-gw-cw-role",
    ...
}
$ AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=000000000002 awslocal apigateway get-account
{
    "cloudwatchRoleArn": "arn:aws:iam::000000000002:role/api-gw-cw-role",
    ...
}
```
This might create some issues, but I don't think we currently have the CloudWatch integration with APIGW, so it shouldn't be an IAM issue I hope.

Do you see how this could be achieved with the current architecture? Even a big a refactor in APIGW might not solve this if `ApiGatewayStore.account` is called in different places, we would need to manually update the account after the store instantiation. How can we address this issue?

issue.title: fixed describe sfn exception

labels.name: aws:stepfunctions
labels.description: AWS Step Functions

labels.name: semver: patch
labels.description: Non-breaking bugfix PR which can be contained in patch releases

milestone.description: All PRs which should make it into 3.0.

issue.body:
<!-- Please refer to the contribution guidelines before raising a PR: https://github.com/localstack/localstack/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md -->

<!-- Why am I raising this PR? Add context such as related issues, PRs, or documentation. -->
## Motivation
This PR fixes the exception raised when calling describe api on non-existing state machine. Which was causing the terraform to fail.

<!-- What notable changes does this PR make? -->
## Changes
Replaced the `ExecutionDoesNotExists` exception to `StateMachineDoesNot` exists


## Testing
Added AWS validated test cases for the updated exception


## Related Issue
- https://github.com/localstack/localstack/issues/9439

comment.body:
Hello, one question about this fix.
Will this make terraform destroy to succeed ? Because how is changing the exception class going to make terraform continue to the end ? The exception is still raised right ?

commits.message: SQS: Introduce 'standard' queue URL strategy (#9454)

Implmentation of AWS::SecretsManager:* Resource Providers for CloudFormation (#9455)

* Initial implementation of AWS::SecretsManager::Secret

* Support for AWS::SecretsManager::ResourcePolicy was added.

* Added AWS::SecretsManager::SecretTargetAttachment and RotationSchedule in CloudFormation.
Fix CFn schema json name resolution for resource providers in -ext (#9478)

Add CFn conditional test (#8590)

Co-authored-by: Cristopher Pinzon <cristopher.pinzon@gmail.com>

Add AWS::Logs::* Resource Providers to CloudFormation (#9447)

* Add AWS::Logs::LogGroup support to CloudFormation

* Added support for AWS::Logs::LogStream in CloudFormation.

* Integrate AWS::Logs::SubscriptionFilter in CloudFormation
fixed describe non-existing sfn exception (#9481)
